result_equations.equation: vec R = n_1 vec a_1 + n_2 vec a_2 + n_3 vec a_3
rho(vec r) = rho(vec r + vec R)

explanation: Crystal lattice structure describes the periodic arrangement of atoms in crystalline solids. The structure is characterized by a unit cell with basis vectors that, when repeated, generates the entire crystal through translational symmetry. This periodicity determines fundamental properties like mechanical strength, electrical conductivity, and optical behavior of materials.

definitions.definition: Lattice vector pointing to equivalent lattice points.

definitions.symbol: vec a_1, vec a_2, vec a_3

definitions.definition: Electron density or mass density at position r.

assumptions.text: The crystal has perfect translational periodicity (ideal crystal).
Atomic positions are well-defined and static (neglecting thermal motion).
The crystal extends infinitely in all directions.
The crystal structure can be described by discrete translational symmetry.
Basis vectors are linearly independent and span 3D space.

derivation.description: Define the fundamental unit cell with three primitive vectors.
derivation.equation: Unit cell: smallest repeating unit with vectors vec a_1, vec a_2, vec a_3

derivation.description: Generate all lattice points by integer linear combinations of basis vectors.
derivation.equation: Lattice points: vec R_n = n_1 vec a_1 + n_2 vec a_2 + n_3 vec a_3

derivation.description: Define translation operators that shift the crystal by lattice vectors.
derivation.equation: Translation operation: T_R f(vec r) = f(vec r - vec R)

derivation.description: Impose periodicity: physical properties repeat at equivalent lattice points.
derivation.equation: Periodicity condition: T_R rho(vec r) = rho(vec r)

derivation.description: Classify all possible 3D lattice types (14 Bravais lattices).
Include rotational and reflection symmetries at each lattice point.
derivation.equation: Point group symmetries: rotation, reflection, inversion

derivation.description: Combine translational and point symmetries to form space groups.
derivation.equation: Space group: lattice translations + point group operations

derivation.description: Group lattices by symmetry into seven crystal systems.
derivation.equation: Crystal systems: 7 unique systems based on lattice parameters
